intro: Gonolobus chrysanthus, commonly known as the golden globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine, silky hairs. Gonolobus chrysanthus thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
